unnormalised: **Vendor Audits Tighten Supply Chain Resilience Amid Festive Demand**
normalised: Vendor Audits Tighten Supply Chain Resilience Amid Festive Demand

unnormalised: Mumbai – Manufacturers across India are ramping up vendor audits in anticipation of increased demand during the upcoming Onam season, traditionally a period of heightened consumer spending. A recent study by the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) highlights a 25% increase in planned audits compared to the same period last year.
normalised: Mumbai – Manufacturers across India are ramping up vendor audits in anticipation of increased demand during the upcoming Onam season, traditionally a period of heightened consumer spending. A recent study by the Confederation of Indian Industry (C I I) highlights a twenty five percent increase in planned audits compared to the same period last year.

unnormalised: "Ensuring supply chain integrity is crucial, especially as we approach peak festive season," stated Mr. Rajesh Kumar, Head of Operations at Tata Steel. "Our audits cover everything from raw material sourcing in Chhattisgarh to manufacturing processes in our Jamshedpur plant."
normalised: "Ensuring supply chain integrity is crucial, especially as we approach peak festive season," stated Mister Rajesh Kumar, Head of Operations at Tata Steel. "Our audits cover everything from raw material sourcing in Chhattisgarh to manufacturing processes in our Jamshedpur plant."

unnormalised: The audits focus on quality control, ethical labour practices, and compliance with environmental regulations. Several companies, including Mahindra & Mahindra, are leveraging technology like blockchain to enhance transparency and traceability in their vendor networks. A critical component is ensuring that all vendors meet the food safety standards, necessary when supplying ingredients for iconic dishes like biryani, consumed heavily during celebrations. Non-compliance can lead to penalties ranging from Rs. 50,000 to Rs. 5 lakhs, according to the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) guidelines. These audits are expected to continue throughout the year, with follow-up checks scheduled every 6 months to maintain consistent standards.
